docs.text:
Welcome to T1nk3r, your ultimate guide to navigating the realms of DevOps, SRE, and creating efficient homelabs. Whether you're a seasoned professional looking to refine your skills or a curious enthusiast starting your journey, you've landed in the right place. Here, I curate practical insights, tutorials, and resources to empower you in mastering the art of infrastructure automation, reliable software deployment, and optimizing your home setup. Let's embark together on this transformative journey into the world of modern IT practices and home technology integration.

Just so you know

This documentation is a curation of all that i've learned over the years of tinkering and resolving infrastructure issues. Enjoy

docs.title: Bash Overview
docs.text: Welcome to the my not so comprehensive Bash documentation, designed to empower users with the essential knowledge and practical insights into harnessing the power of Bash for various tasks. Whether you're a beginner or an advanced user, this documentation covers a wide range of topics, enjoy!

docs.title: Command Prompt Overview
docs.text: Welcome to the my not so comprehensive PowerShell documentation, designed to empower users with the essential knowledge and practical insights into harnessing the power of PowerShell for various tasks. Whether you're a beginner or an advanced user, this documentation covers a wide range of topics, enjoy!

docs.title: Install a windows service
docs.text:
sc create name_of_the_service binPath="path\to\theexecutable.exe" DisplayName="name_of_the_service"

Tip

Since this is an admin features, make sure to run this in an elevated window. You can also create multiple services at once using a .cmd file and runing it once

docs.title: Install an NService Bus service in windows
Powershell Overview
docs.text: Welcome to the my not so comprehensive PowerShell documentation, designed to empower users with the essential knowledge and practical insights into harnessing the power of PowerShell for various tasks. Whether you're a beginner or an advanced user, this documentation covers a wide range of topics, enjoy!

docs.title: Get list of all installed windows server optional features
docs.text:
Get-WindowsOptionalFeature -Online | where {$_.state -eq "Enabled"} | ft -Property featurename

Tip

Since these are admin features, make sure to run this in an elevated window. You can also output to a file by pipeing result using below command 

| Out-File -FilePath "path\tofile.txt"

docs.title: How to kill a process
docs.text:
taskkill /f /pid <pid>

Tip

Make sure to find the pid using Task Manager and replace <pid> with the unique value.

docs.title: Set time and date to specific time zone
docs.text:
Set-TimeZone -Name "Central Standard Time"

Tip

This is an admin feature, run in elevated window. Use Get-TimeZone to know which one you are currently set to. Use Get-TimeZone -ListAvailable to get all possible time zones you can apply.

Set a single service account to multiple windows services
